segment.source: In order to receive money from app sales in the Windows Store, you need to set up your payout account and fill out the necessary tax forms.
segment.target: In order to receive money from app sales in the Windows Store, you need to set up your payout account and fill out the necessary tax forms.

segment.source: Setting up your payout account and tax forms
segment.target: Setting up your payout account and tax forms

segment.source: Setting up your payout account and tax forms
segment.target: Setting up your payout account and tax forms

segment.source: In order to receive money from app sales in the Windows Store, you need to set up your payout account and fill out the necessary tax forms.
segment.target: In order to receive money from app sales in the Windows Store, you need to set up your payout account and fill out the necessary tax forms.

segment.source: If you only plan to list free apps (and don't plan to offer in-app purchases), you don't need to set up a payout account or fill out any tax forms.
segment.target: If you only plan to list free apps (and don't plan to offer in-app purchases), you don't need to set up a payout account or fill out any tax forms.

segment.source: If you change your mind later and decide you do want to sell apps (or in-app products), you can set up your payout account and fill out tax forms at that time.
segment.target: If you change your mind later and decide you do want to sell apps (or in-app products), you can set up your payout account and fill out tax forms at that time.

segment.source: You won't be able to submit any paid apps or IAPs until your payout account and tax profile has been completed.
segment.target: You won't be able to submit any paid apps or IAPs until your payout account and tax profile has been completed.

segment.source: Note Certain markets only allow you to list free apps.
segment.target: Note Certain markets only allow you to list free apps.

segment.source: If your account is registered in one of these markets, you will not have the option to set up a payout account.
segment.target: If your account is registered in one of these markets, you will not have the option to set up a payout account.

segment.source: After you have set up your developer account, there are two things you need to do before you can sell apps (or IAPs) in the Windows Store:
segment.target: After you have set up your developer account, there are two things you need to do before you can sell apps (or IAPs) in the Windows Store:

segment.source: Set up your payout account
segment.target: Set up your payout account

segment.source: Fill out your tax forms
segment.target: Fill out your tax forms

segment.source: Note For details about how and when you will be paid for the money your apps make, see Getting paid.
segment.target: Note For details about how and when you will be paid for the money your apps make, see Getting paid.

segment.source: Payout account
segment.target: Payout account

segment.source: A payout account is the bank account to which we send the proceeds from your sales.
segment.target: A payout account is the bank account to which we send the proceeds from your sales.

segment.source: This bank account must be located in the same country where you registered your developer account.
segment.target: This bank account must be located in the same country where you registered your developer account.

segment.source: Note In some markets, PayPal can be used as a payment method.
segment.target: Note In some markets, PayPal can be used as a payment method.

segment.source: See Account types, locations, and fees to find out if PayPal is supported for a specific market, and read the PayPal info below for more details.
segment.target: See Account types, locations, and fees to find out if PayPal is supported for a specific market, and read the PayPal info below for more details.

segment.source: To set up your payout account
segment.target: To set up your payout account

segment.source: In the Windows Dev Center dashboard, and click Account settings in the left navigation menu.
segment.target: In the Windows Dev Center dashboard, and click Account settings in the left navigation menu.

segment.source: In the left navigation menu of the Account settings page, click Payout account.
segment.target: In the left navigation menu of the Account settings page, click Payout account.

segment.source: Note Because this is sensitive info, you may be prompted to sign in again.
segment.target: Note Because this is sensitive info, you may be prompted to sign in again.

segment.source: On the screen that appears, fill out the info for your account.
segment.target: On the screen that appears, fill out the info for your account.

segment.source: Note The fields you use to provide your account info accept only alphanumeric characters.
segment.target: Note The fields you use to provide your account info accept only alphanumeric characters.

segment.source: Save your info.
segment.target: Save your info.

segment.source: If you need to update or change your payout account, follow the same steps above, replacing the current info with the new info.
segment.target: If you need to update or change your payout account, follow the same steps above, replacing the current info with the new info.

segment.source: Important Changing your payout account can delay your payments by up to one payment cycle.
segment.target: Important Changing your payout account can delay your payments by up to one payment cycle.

segment.source: This delay occurs because we need to verify the account change, just as we did when you first set up the payout account.
segment.target: This delay occurs because we need to verify the account change, just as we did when you first set up the payout account.

segment.source: You'll still get paid for the full amount after your account has been verified; any payments due for the current payment cycle will be added to the next one.
segment.target: You'll still get paid for the full amount after your account has been verified; any payments due for the current payment cycle will be added to the next one.

segment.source: See Getting paid for more info.
segment.target: See Getting paid for more info.

segment.source: PayPal info
segment.target: PayPal info

segment.source: In select countries and regions, you can create a payment account by entering your PayPal info.
segment.target: In select countries and regions, you can create a payment account by entering your PayPal info.

segment.source: However, before choosing PayPal as a payment account option:
segment.target: However, before choosing PayPal as a payment account option:

segment.source: Check Account types, locations, and fees to see if PayPal is a supported payment method in your country or region.
segment.target: Check Account types, locations, and fees to see if PayPal is a supported payment method in your country or region.

segment.source: Review the following FAQs.
segment.target: Review the following FAQs.

segment.source: Depending on your situation, PayPal may not be the best payment account option for you, and a bank account may be preferred.
segment.target: Depending on your situation, PayPal may not be the best payment account option for you, and a bank account may be preferred.

segment.source: Common questions about using PayPal as a payment method:
segment.target: Common questions about using PayPal as a payment method:

segment.source: What PayPal settings do I need to have in order to receive payments?
segment.target: What PayPal settings do I need to have in order to receive payments?

segment.source: You must ensure that your PayPal account does not block eCheck payments.
segment.target: You must ensure that your PayPal account does not block eCheck payments.

segment.source: This setting is managed in PayPal’s Payment Receiving Preferences page.
segment.target: This setting is managed in PayPal’s Payment Receiving Preferences page.

segment.source: See PayPal’s account setup page for more info.
segment.target: See PayPal’s account setup page for more info.

segment.source: Is my country/region supported?
segment.target: Is my country/region supported?

segment.source: See Account types, locations, and fees to find out where PayPal is a supported payment method.
segment.target: See Account types, locations, and fees to find out where PayPal is a supported payment method.

segment.source: Is there a restriction on the size of payments that I can receive using PayPal?
segment.target: Is there a restriction on the size of payments that I can receive using PayPal?

segment.source: Yes.
segment.target: Yes.

segment.source: PayPal limits the amount of money that users can receive in a single transaction.
segment.target: PayPal limits the amount of money that users can receive in a single transaction.

segment.source: The limits vary by currency; see PayPal’s transaction limit page for each currency’s limit.
segment.target: The limits vary by currency; see PayPal’s transaction limit page for each currency’s limit.

segment.source: If you anticipate that you will receive a payment greater than your PayPal transaction limit, change your payment method to a bank account.
segment.target: If you anticipate that you will receive a payment greater than your PayPal transaction limit, change your payment method to a bank account.

segment.source: Does my PayPal account have to be registered in the same country/region as my Dev Center account?
segment.target: Does my PayPal account have to be registered in the same country/region as my Dev Center account?

segment.source: No.
segment.target: No.

segment.source: When you set up a PayPal account, you can accept the default configuration.
segment.target: When you set up a PayPal account, you can accept the default configuration.

segment.source: You shouldn’t have any issues with other countries/regions and currencies unless you have blocked payment in some currencies.
segment.target: You shouldn’t have any issues with other countries/regions and currencies unless you have blocked payment in some currencies.

segment.source: This setting is managed in PayPal’s Payment Receiving Preferences page.
segment.target: This setting is managed in PayPal’s Payment Receiving Preferences page.

segment.source: Do I have to accept PayPal payments manually?
segment.target: Do I have to accept PayPal payments manually?

segment.source: No.
segment.target: No.

segment.source: PayPal accounts are set by default to require users to accept payments manually, which means if you don’t accept the payment within 30 days, it is returned.
segment.target: PayPal accounts are set by default to require users to accept payments manually, which means if you don’t accept the payment within 30 days, it is returned.

segment.source: You can change this setting by turning off “Ask Me” in PayPal’s More Settings page.
segment.target: You can change this setting by turning off “Ask Me” in PayPal’s More Settings page.

segment.source: Specific requirements for certain countries/regions
segment.target: Specific requirements for certain countries/regions

segment.source: In some countries and regions, additional requirements for payout accounts must be followed.
segment.target: In some countries and regions, additional requirements for payout accounts must be followed.

segment.source: If you are a resident of Pakistan, Russia, or Ukraine, please note the following requirements.
segment.target: If you are a resident of Pakistan, Russia, or Ukraine, please note the following requirements.

segment.source: Pakistan
segment.target: Pakistan

segment.source: Form-R is a Pakistan banking regulatory requirement.
segment.target: Form-R is a Pakistan banking regulatory requirement.

segment.source: It is used to indicate the purpose and reason for receipt of funds from abroad.
segment.target: It is used to indicate the purpose and reason for receipt of funds from abroad.

segment.source: Therefore, anytime that you are eligible for a monthly payout from Microsoft, you will need to submit a Form-R to your bank before the payout can be released to your account.
segment.target: Therefore, anytime that you are eligible for a monthly payout from Microsoft, you will need to submit a Form-R to your bank before the payout can be released to your account.

segment.source: Contact your local bank branch for instructions on how to obtain a copy of Form-R.
segment.target: Contact your local bank branch for instructions on how to obtain a copy of Form-R.

segment.source: You will need to submit a Form-R to your bank each month that you are eligible for a payout.
segment.target: You will need to submit a Form-R to your bank each month that you are eligible for a payout.

segment.source: For example, if you expect to receive a payout every month of the year, you will need to submit a Form-R 12 times (once each month).
segment.target: For example, if you expect to receive a payout every month of the year, you will need to submit a Form-R 12 times (once each month).

segment.source: Once the payout has been submitted to your bank, you have 30 days to submit a Form-R.
segment.target: Once the payout has been submitted to your bank, you have 30 days to submit a Form-R.

segment.source: If it is not submitted within 30 days, the funds will be returned to Microsoft.
segment.target: If it is not submitted within 30 days, the funds will be returned to Microsoft.

segment.source: Russia
segment.target: Russia

segment.source: If you’re a developer who lives in Russia, you may need to provide documentation to your bank before your bank will deposit funds into your account.
segment.target: If you’re a developer who lives in Russia, you may need to provide documentation to your bank before your bank will deposit funds into your account.

segment.source: When you’re eligible to be paid, we will provide you with the following documentation in an email message:
segment.target: When you’re eligible to be paid, we will provide you with the following documentation in an email message:

segment.source: Certificate of Acceptance (CoA) – contains the amount of payout being transferred to your account.
segment.target: Certificate of Acceptance (CoA) – contains the amount of payout being transferred to your account.

segment.source: App Developer Agreement (ADA) – a signed copy of the developer agreement that needs to be counter signed.
segment.target: App Developer Agreement (ADA) – a signed copy of the developer agreement that needs to be counter signed.

segment.source: To ensure your payout is successful, please also keep in mind the following:
segment.target: To ensure your payout is successful, please also keep in mind the following:

segment.source: The Account holder name entered for your payout account in the Windows Dev Center dashboard must be the exact same name associated with your bank account.
segment.target: The Account holder name entered for your payout account in the Windows Dev Center dashboard must be the exact same name associated with your bank account.

segment.source: For example, if your bank account name contains a middle name, add a middle name to your Account holder name.
segment.target: For example, if your bank account name contains a middle name, add a middle name to your Account holder name.

segment.source: Payouts are transferred directly from Microsoft to your bank account in Ruble (RUB) currency.
segment.target: Payouts are transferred directly from Microsoft to your bank account in Ruble (RUB) currency.

segment.source: Bank information entered in Dev Center in Latin characters is translated to Cyrillic characters.
segment.target: Bank information entered in Dev Center in Latin characters is translated to Cyrillic characters.

segment.source: Payouts must be made to a bank account and not to a bank card.
segment.target: Payouts must be made to a bank account and not to a bank card.

segment.source: Ukraine
segment.target: Ukraine

segment.source: If you’re a developer who lives in Ukraine, you may need to provide documentation to your bank before your bank will deposit funds into your account.
segment.target: If you’re a developer who lives in Ukraine, you may need to provide documentation to your bank before your bank will deposit funds into your account.

segment.source: When you’re eligible to be paid, we will provide you with the following documentation in an email message:
segment.target: When you’re eligible to be paid, we will provide you with the following documentation in an email message:

segment.source: Certificate of Acceptance (CoA) – contains the amount of payout being transferred to your account.
segment.target: Certificate of Acceptance (CoA) – contains the amount of payout being transferred to your account.

segment.source: App Developer Agreement (ADA) – a signed copy of the developer agreement that needs to be counter signed.
segment.target: App Developer Agreement (ADA) – a signed copy of the developer agreement that needs to be counter signed.

segment.source: Amendment Agreement (AA) – this document can be used by your bank to help identify your payout funds.
segment.target: Amendment Agreement (AA) – this document can be used by your bank to help identify your payout funds.

segment.source: Microsoft provides all three documents when your first payout is attempted.
segment.target: Microsoft provides all three documents when your first payout is attempted.

segment.source: For any subsequent payouts, you will only receive the CoA document.
segment.target: For any subsequent payouts, you will only receive the CoA document.

segment.source: Please retain the ADA and AA documents in case you need them to receive future payouts from your bank.
segment.target: Please retain the ADA and AA documents in case you need them to receive future payouts from your bank.

segment.source: To ensure your payout is successful, please also keep in mind the following:
segment.target: To ensure your payout is successful, please also keep in mind the following:

segment.source: The Account holder name entered for your payout account in the Windows Dev Center dashboard must be the exact same name associated with your bank account.
segment.target: The Account holder name entered for your payout account in the Windows Dev Center dashboard must be the exact same name associated with your bank account.

segment.source: For example, if your bank account name contains a middle name, add a middle name to your Account holder name.
segment.target: For example, if your bank account name contains a middle name, add a middle name to your Account holder name.

segment.source: Payouts are transferred directly from Microsoft to your bank account in USD currency.
segment.target: Payouts are transferred directly from Microsoft to your bank account in USD currency.

segment.source: Bank information entered in Dev Center in Latin characters is translated to Cyrillic characters.
segment.target: Bank information entered in Dev Center in Latin characters is translated to Cyrillic characters.

segment.source: Tax forms
segment.target: Tax forms

segment.source: After you have registered for a developer account and set up your payout account, you can create your tax profile for the Windows Store by completing the following steps:
segment.target: After you have registered for a developer account and set up your payout account, you can create your tax profile for the Windows Store by completing the following steps:

segment.source: Specify your country of residence and citizenship.
segment.target: Specify your country of residence and citizenship.

segment.source: Fill out the appropriate tax forms.
segment.target: Fill out the appropriate tax forms.

segment.source: You can complete and submit your tax forms electronically in your dashboard; in most cases, you don't need to print and mail any forms.
segment.target: You can complete and submit your tax forms electronically in your dashboard; in most cases, you don't need to print and mail any forms.

segment.source: Important Different countries and regions have different tax requirements.
segment.target: Important Different countries and regions have different tax requirements.

segment.source: The exact amount that you must pay in taxes depends on the countries and regions where you sell your apps.
segment.target: The exact amount that you must pay in taxes depends on the countries and regions where you sell your apps.

segment.source: See the App Developer Agreement to find out for which countries Microsoft remits sales and use tax on your behalf.
segment.target: See the App Developer Agreement to find out for which countries Microsoft remits sales and use tax on your behalf.

segment.source: In other countries, depending on where you are registered, you may need to remit sales and use tax for your app sales directly to the local taxing authority.
segment.target: In other countries, depending on where you are registered, you may need to remit sales and use tax for your app sales directly to the local taxing authority.

segment.source: In addition, the app sales proceeds you receive may be taxable as income.
segment.target: In addition, the app sales proceeds you receive may be taxable as income.

segment.source: We strongly encourage you to contact the relevant authority for your country or region that can best help you determine the right tax info for your Windows Store developer activities.
segment.target: We strongly encourage you to contact the relevant authority for your country or region that can best help you determine the right tax info for your Windows Store developer activities.

segment.source: To complete your tax profile
segment.target: To complete your tax profile

segment.source: In the Windows Dev Center dashboard, click Account settings in the left navigation menu.
segment.target: In the Windows Dev Center dashboard, click Account settings in the left navigation menu.

segment.source: In the left navigation menu of the Account settings page, click Tax profile.
segment.target: In the left navigation menu of the Account settings page, click Tax profile.

segment.source: Note Because this is sensitive info, you may be prompted to sign in again.
segment.target: Note Because this is sensitive info, you may be prompted to sign in again.

segment.source: Review your current tax profile status and click Edit to complete the required forms.
segment.target: Review your current tax profile status and click Edit to complete the required forms.

segment.source: Answer the questions about United States citizenship and residency, then click Next.
segment.target: Answer the questions about United States citizenship and residency, then click Next.

segment.source: If your name and address info are displayed, confirm them for the purposes of filing taxes.
segment.target: If your name and address info are displayed, confirm them for the purposes of filing taxes.

segment.source: Next, you will see electronic versions of the tax forms that you must complete.
segment.target: Next, you will see electronic versions of the tax forms that you must complete.

segment.source: Regardless of your country of residence or citizenship, you must fill out United States tax forms to sell any apps or in-app products through the Windows Store.
segment.target: Regardless of your country of residence or citizenship, you must fill out United States tax forms to sell any apps or in-app products through the Windows Store.

segment.source: Developers who satisfy certain United States residency requirements must fill out an IRS W-9 form.
segment.target: Developers who satisfy certain United States residency requirements must fill out an IRS W-9 form.

segment.source: Other developers outside the United States must fill out an IRS W-8 form.
segment.target: Other developers outside the United States must fill out an IRS W-8 form.

segment.source: You can fill out these forms online as you complete your tax profile.
segment.target: You can fill out these forms online as you complete your tax profile.

segment.source: A United States Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (or ITIN) is not required to receive payments from Microsoft or to claim tax treaty benefits.
segment.target: A United States Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (or ITIN) is not required to receive payments from Microsoft or to claim tax treaty benefits.

segment.source: Withholding rates
segment.target: Withholding rates

segment.source: The info you submit in your tax forms determines the appropriate tax withholding rate.
segment.target: The info you submit in your tax forms determines the appropriate tax withholding rate.

segment.source: The withholding rate applies only to sales that you make into the United States; sales made into non-US locations are not subject to withholding.
segment.target: The withholding rate applies only to sales that you make into the United States; sales made into non-US locations are not subject to withholding.

segment.source: The withholding rates vary, but for most developers registering outside the United States, the default rate is 30%.
segment.target: The withholding rates vary, but for most developers registering outside the United States, the default rate is 30%.

segment.source: You have the option of reducing this rate if your country has agreed to an income tax treaty with the United States.
segment.target: You have the option of reducing this rate if your country has agreed to an income tax treaty with the United States.

segment.source: Tax treaty benefits
segment.target: Tax treaty benefits

segment.source: If you are outside the United States, you may be able to take advantage of tax treaty benefits.
segment.target: If you are outside the United States, you may be able to take advantage of tax treaty benefits.

segment.source: These benefits vary from country to country, and may allow you to reduce the amount of taxes that the Windows Store withholds.
segment.target: These benefits vary from country to country, and may allow you to reduce the amount of taxes that the Windows Store withholds.

segment.source: You can claim tax treaty benefits by completing Part II of the W-8BEN form.
segment.target: You can claim tax treaty benefits by completing Part II of the W-8BEN form.

segment.source: We recommend that you communicate with the appropriate resources in your country or region to determine whether these benefits apply to you.
segment.target: We recommend that you communicate with the appropriate resources in your country or region to determine whether these benefits apply to you.
